content:
• Monday, March 6, 2017
  • FIT

    Fitbit announces leadership changes, business alignment

    • Fitbit (FIT -1.2%) has announced changes to its leadership team, including a pair of executive departures, and a business realignment.
    • Chief Business Officer Woody Scal and Executive VP, Interactive Tim Roberts -- two of the company's first employees -- will depart the company by the end of the month.
    • VP of Engineering Samir Kapoor is being promoted to senior VP of Device Engineering, reporting to the company's CTO and co-founder Eric Friedman.
    • The company says it's formally realigning around two focus areas: Consumer Health and Fitness; and Enterprise Health.
    • Consumer Health and Fitness will focus on delivering a streamlined set of health and fitness devices, entering new markets such as the smartwatch category and offering premium software and services that provide more personalized insights and guidance," the company says. "Enterprise Health will expand on the company’s early successes in working with insurance companies, employers, health systems and other healthcare partners.
    • After hours: FIT +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM | 31 Comments
  • SALE

    RetailMeNot IR/development head moves to contractor status

    • RetailMeNot (SALE -2.3%) notes in a filing that its senior VP, Corporate Development and Investor Relations resigned his position.
    • It's entered into a contractor agreement with Michael Magaro to provide some investor relations and corporate development services to the company instead.
    • The agreement filed with the SEC is a deal running from April 1, 2017, to May 15, 2017, for a fixed fee of $96,666 plus expenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford snags Halliburton CFO McCollum as its new CEO

    • Weatherford (NYSE:WFT) +10.3% AH after appointing Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) CFO Mark McCollum as its new President and CEO, effective in late April.
    • McCollum 36 years' experience in the energy sector includes two periods as HAL's CFO during 2008-14 and July 2016 to the present, as well as an interim role as Chief Integration Officer during HAL's proposed acquisition of Baker Hughes; previously, he had held various senior positions at Tenneco, including CFO, and at Arthur Andersen.
    • Krishna Shivram will depart as interim CEO, effective immediately; WFT CFO Christoph Bausch will serve as acting CEO until McCollum assumes the role in a permanent capacity.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM | 11 Comments
  • MEET

    MeetMe +19.3%; Q4 2016 positive, if(we) acquired

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $29.2M (+46.9% Y/Y, $0.45M above estimates), EPS $0.19 ($0.03 above estimates), Mobile revenue $27.8M (+62% Y/Y), net income $12.4M (+56% Y/Y), adjusted EBITDA $12.8M (+42% Y/Y), cash and cash equivalents $21.9M
    • Other developments – Acquires if(we) for $60M in cash.
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:MEET) $6.05
    • Press release / conference call / presentation slides / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 5 Comments
  • DISH

    Dish Network joining S&P 500; shares up 5.1%

    • Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) is up 5.1% after hours on news that it will enter the S&P 500.
    • The stock is making the move before Monday's open. It will replace Linear Technology, set to be acquired by Analog Devices in a deal about to close.
    • Dish Network will join the 500's Cable & Satellite Sub-Industry Index.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • CRM

    IBM, Salesforce form global strategic partnership

    • IBM Watson and Salesforce Eintstein are integrating in effort to enhance customer engagement among sales, service, commerce, marketing and other areas.
    • Additionally, IBM initiates strategic investment in its Global Business Services features for Salesforce, with new function of aiding deployment of merged IBM Watson and Salesforce Einstein capabilities to be added.
    • Component of the arrangement, IBM will internally deploy Salesforce Service Cloud.
    • Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) +2.12%, IBM (NYSE:IBM) +0.09% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 10 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: ASNA +5.3%. PIR +5.1%. DISH +4.6%. ATSG +3.6%. WMC +2.8%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: PCRX -5.2%. CASY -3.9%. HASI -3.6%. THO -2.9%. JPEP -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • IDT

    Revenues, profits drop in IDT's second quarter

    • IDT (IDT -4.1%) is flat after hours following fiscal second quarter earnings where profits slipped along with revenues, though the company pointed to momentum in products that will drive forward growth.
    • "We introduced the BOSS Revolution Money app including our flagship international money transfer service and released a major update of the BOSS Revolution calling app including messaging and free peer-to-peer calling," says CEO Shmuel Jonas, noting the two apps now work in tandem for convenience.
    • Meanwhile, National Retail Solutions has increased customers for its POS terminals tenfold, and net2phone quadrupled its customer base over the past year.
    • The company partly offset a revenue decline of 3.9% by cutting costs (SG&A expense was down 7.3%).
    • Revenue by segment: TPS, $358.5M (down 3.3%); UCaaS, $7.1M (up 16.4%); CPS, $1.4M (down 22.2%); other, $0.5M (down 87.5%).
    • Conference call to come at 5:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • SNAP

    Snap closes below IPO open amid expanding negative sentiment

    • With scrutiny sustaining over valuation, corporate governance, and various business risk factors, combined with the absence of any buy-equivalent sell-side ratings (and a growing list of negative and neutral standpoints), Snap (NYSE:SNAP) shares have reduced to $23.50 and below in extended Monday trade, marking the lowest levels (IPO open $24, offer $17) since public share availability began last Thursday.
    • Previously – Nomura, Pivotal Research negative on Snap amid trading debut (March 2) / Susquehanna initiates Snap at Neutral, $22 target (March 3) / Snap downgraded to Underweight at Atlantic Equities (March 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 82 Comments
  • VRML

    Vermillion's ASPiRA LABs secures out-of-state provider status with California Medicaid; shares; shares ahead 7% after hours

    • Thinly traded micro cap Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML) is up 7% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that subsidiary ASPiRA LABs has attained out-of-state provider status with Medi-Cal, California's Medicaid program, for its ovarian cancer risk assessment test OVA1/Multivariate Index Assay (MIA). Medi-Cal has over 12M benefiiciaries.
    • CEO Valerie Palmieri says, "We are pleased to announce our new Medi-Cal provider status for OVA1 (MIA). This new status is an expansion to our prior Medi-Cal coverage and is key to reaching the entire Medicaid base, as well as expanding OVA1 (MIA) access in the state with the largest U.S. population. It should also create additional opportunities with healthcare systems and other medical insurers in the California market."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • PCRX

    Pacira readies $300M convertible debt offering; shares off 9% after hours

    • Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) initiates a direct offering of $300M aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2022 to qualified institutional investors. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 9% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • DKS

    Favorable reads on Dick's just ahead of earnings

    • Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) is undervalued, according to the WSJ's Steven Russolillo
    • The retailer was swept up into a sector-wide sell-off tied to border tax fears and slow traffic trends, but has actually been showing improved margin and comp sales trends.
    • RBC also has a favorable read on Dick's, noting that the market is underappreciating the positive impact of consolidation in the sporting goods industry.
    • Dick's reports earnings tomorrow morning before the bell. Consensus estimates are for revenue of $2.48, EPS of $1.30 and comparable sales growth of 4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • KURA

    Kura's lead candidate tipifarnib continues to demonstrate treatment benefit in mid-stage study; shares off 17% on profit taking

    • In an example of "sell on the news," Kura Oncology (KURA -17%) is experiencing profit-taking after last week's 60% run-up. The company announced updated data from its ongoing Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead product candidate tipifarnib in solid tumors today. The results were presented at the 15th International Congress on Targeted Anticancer Therapies in Paris.
    • Two responders with HRAS mutation-positive squamous cell carcinomas of the head and neck (SCCHN) remain on study at treatment cycle 19 and 12, respectively.
    • Three of five patients with HRAS-positive salivary gland cancer have stable disease through treatment cycles 9, 10 and 14, respectively.
    • Tipifarnib inhibits an enzyme called farnesyl transferase. Interfering with its function inhibits protein farnesylation, a key signaling process in cancer initiation and development. Farnesyl transferase inhibitors have shown particular promise in blocking HRAS farnesylation.
    • Previously: Kura's lead product candidate shows encouraging results in mid-stage study; shares up 32% after hours (Aug. 10, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • NEM

    Newmont gains rights to explore, develop prospective new Yukon gold district

    • Newmont Mining (NEM -3.7%) reaches an agreement to access and explore a highly prospective gold district in Canada’s Yukon Territory through a private placement with Goldstrike Resources that entitles NEM to earn up to 80% equity in the district through exploration investment.
    • NEM says initial drill results for the Plateau property are promising, and high grade gold mineralization has been identified over a 50 km strike length.
    • NEM also says it expects to increase its exploration and advanced projects capex by 22% this year, with two-thirds used to fund more brownfields and greenfields exploration.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: CCIH +13%. POLA +10%. KONE +9%. MRIN +8%. MATR +7%.
    • Losers: NH -19%. GRVY -17%. SNAP -9%. SUNW -8%. ENPH -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • ERN

    Erin Energy, Pacific Drilling reach drilling deal for Nigerian offshore field

    • Erin Energy (ERN +1.4%) announces a drilling services contract with Pacific Drilling (PACD -9.5%) to use the Pacific Bora rig to drill the Oyo-9 well in the deepwater Oyo Field offshore Nigeria.
    • ERN says it has the option to drill up to two additional wells, and to extend the contract to drill two of its offshore Nigeria exploration prospects in the Miocene geological zone.
    • ERN anticipates spudding the Oyo-9 in mid-June and first production from the well in September, and expects Oyo-9 to add 6K-7K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • RH

    RH moves higher on takeover chatter

    • RH (NYSE:RH) is rallying today after Betaville's Ben Harrington stirred up takeover speculation.
    • Harrington mentioned the stock during an interview on TipTV (video).
    • Shares of RH are up 2.53% to $31.99 vs. a 52-week trading range of $24.41 to $46.87.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: ESTE +7%. URRE +6%. TAT +5%.
    • Losers: GBR -13%. BCEI -11%. PACD -10%. TELL -9%. AAU -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • BIOS

    Jefferies boosts price target on BioScrip; shares ahead 20%

    • BioScrip (BIOS +19.6%) bucks the market's down day on more than a 4x surge in volume. This morning, Jefferies raised the price target 20% to $3 (36% upside) and reiterated its Buy rating.
    • Analyst Brian Tanquilut is "incrementally positive" on the stock after its Q4 beat citing good growth in core revenues that should offset the headwinds from the 21st Century Cures Act. He adds that EBITDA is on track to exceed $80M in 2018.
    • Source: StreetInsider
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 3 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Losers: PN -14%. ZAIS -7%. GLA -7%. WMIH -6%. PMTS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • RRC

    Big day for natural gas amid cooler weather forecasts

    • Natural gas prices are rallying today as recent weather forecasts favor cooler weather across much of the U.S., rising 3.7% to $2.931/MMBtu and extending a rebound that has sent prices higher for four straight trading sessions.
    • Nat gas prices had been held down by tepid demand amid one of the warmest winters on record, but forecasts now see temperatures falling below normal levels in the 6-10 day period and beyond.
    • Gas producers also may be getting a boost from a favorable review in Barron's for Range Resources (RRC +4.7%).
    • Also: SWN +3.1%, COG +2.8%, RICE +4.1%, EQT +1.8%, AR +2.1%, but CHK -0.6%.
    • ETFs: UNG, UGAZ, DGAZ, BOIL, GAZ-OLD, FCG, GASL, KOLD, UNL, GASX, DCNG
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 28 Comments
  • BTI

    British American Tobacco seen running higher off RAI benefits

    • Argus Research upgrades British American Tobacco (BTI -0.4%) to Buy from Hold with an eye on the Reynlds American acquisition.
    • Argus on BTI: "The acquisition, which is expected to close in 3Q17, will increase BTI's exposure to high-growth emerging markets while also strengthening its presence in the U.S. It will also help BTI to expand its R&D program, which is focused on the of e-cigarettes and other smokeless products, and to boost its share of the smokeless market. Management plans to quadruple the number of markets in which it offers e-cigarettes and other smokeless products by 2018. We believe the near-term outlook for British American has improved and see further upside for the shares."
    • The firm assigns a price target of $72 on the tobacco stock vs. a 52-week trading range of $52.71 to $65.67. The ADRs traded as high as $63.13 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: TGTX +76%. CNCE +66%. OTC:DXTR +49%. DPRX +26%. BIOS +22%. CCIH +20%. SPU +17%. FLKS +15%. BLPH +15%.
    • Losers: GRVY -20%. NH -16%. SHLO -16%. MNKD -16%. ATEC -15%. PN -14%. CETX -14%. GBR -12%. AFI -12%. FCEL -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • WPM

    Silver Wheaton willing to settle Canada Revenue case, CEO says

    • Silver Wheaton (SLW -1.7%) is willing to settle its tax dispute with the Canada Revenue Agency case for C$5M-C$10M “with gritted teeth” but still believes no payment should be required, CEO Randy Smallwood says.
    • The CEO says SLW is halfway through the discovery process, which he expects to end in middle of this year; any potential settlement likely would occur shortly after the discovery process but the company is willing to go to trial if a “principled" settlement is not possible.
    • Smallwood says the CRA issue is the most important “catalyst” for SLW stock, which he says is paying too high a price for the uncertainty.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 10 Comments
  • CORR

    CorEnergy Trust downgraded at Stifel on valuation

    • CorEnergy Infrastructure Trust (CORR -4.4%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $34 price target, trimmed from $37, at Stifel, after posting a solid quarter with AFFO of $13.9M and DPU coverage of 1.5x on a flat $0.75 quarterly distribution.
    • CORR notes that Ultra Petroleum remains in bankruptcy, although a confirmation hearing is set and it hopes Ultra will soon emerge from the process; subsequently, Stifel says CORR should receive incremental credit facility capacity with an eye on growing its asset base again.
    • The firm says it maintains a favorable view of CORR's niche structure and management's deal structuring history, but it believes shares are near fair value.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 10 Comments
  • CETV

    Central European Media cuts borrowing cost by 150 basis points

    • Central European Media (NASDAQ:CETV) is up 3.4% after a transaction with Time Warner that will cut its average borrowing cost on debt by 150 basis points.
    • The deal is effective as of March 1, 2017, and involves fees payable to Time Warner in its capacity as guarantor of CETV's senior credit.
    • It reduces the cost of borrowing on a €251M term loan due 2018 by 125 basis points, and gets a similar rate reduction on a €235M term loan due 2019. It also cuts the borrowing cost of a €469M term loan due 2021 by 175 basis points.
    • In all, the weighted average borrowing cost drops to 7.25%.
    • The cost of borrowing will drop a further 50 basis points if the total indebtedness in senior credit facilities is reduced below €815M by Sept. 30, 2018.
    • The move is expected to result in $30M in savings from debt service by the end of next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • AKRX

    Deutsche Bank cuts outlook on Akorn on erosion of ephedrine line; shares ease 7%

    • The market's down day notwithstanding, Akorn (AKRX -7%) is under pressure after Deutsche Bank downgraded the stock to Hold and cut the price target to $24 (6% upside) from $28.
    • Analyst Gregg Gilbert says he likes the large number of ANDA's (marketing applications for generic products) under review at the FDA, but share erosion for its ultra-high-margin ephedrine line, representing almost 20% of revenue, is a significant headwind.
    • Source: StreetInsider
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 2 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SPU +20%.
    • Losers: GPRO -7%. OTIV -7%. NVFY -7%. REV -7%. STKL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • NH

    NantHealth slips 15% on alleged self-dealing between Patrick Soon-Shiong and University of Utah

    • NantHealth (NH -14.8%) a Patrick Soon-Shiong-controlled provider of a molecular test for cancer, called GPS Cancer, is under pressure on double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 290K shares, on a STAT report about a $12M gift by the billionaire in September 2014 to the University of Utah that appeared to direct the bulk of the money ($10M) back to his company.
    • The deal enabled NantHealth to inflate the number of test orders it received for GPS Cancer by more than 50% when it updated investors during its Q3 earnings call in November on the demand for the test. It stated that it had received 524 orders for GPS Cancer, including 1/3 from the University of Utah. A spokesperson from the university and a geneticist who works there said the work they ordered had nothing to do with GPS Cancer, however. It was straightforward genetic sequencing associated with preclinical research.
    • Dr. Soon-Shiong has yet to comment on the matter.
    • Update: On March 16, NantHealth and Dr. Soon-Shiong issued written rebuttals to STAT's assertions.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 25 Comments
  • MLCO

    Melco Crown and SJM bosses see big jump in Macau revenue

    • Melco Crown Entertainment (MPEL -0.8%) Chairman Lawrence Ho expects Macau gaming revenue to increase 5% to 9% this year across the industry.
    • Looking at Melco, Ho thinks the mass market business will benefit in the back half after the Hong Kong-Zuhai-Macau bridge is finished.
    • SJM Holdings (OTCPK:SJMHF, OTCPK:SJMHY) boss Ambrose So Shu Fai sees gaming revenue increasing 10% for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 4 Comments
  • AEM

    Agnico Eagle Mines to buy 38.1M shares of GoldQuest

    • Agnico Eagle Mines (AEM -2.1%) says it will buy 38.1M shares of GoldQuest Mining (OTCPK:GDQMF +14.3%) shares at C$0.60 each for C$22.9M through a non-brokered private placement, which will make AEM the largest holder of GoldQuest with ~15% stake.
    • AEM will have the right to nominate one person to GoldQuest's board and participate in future equity financings.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy -5% as it delays release of Q4, FY 2016 results

    • Cobalt Energy (CIE -4.3%) is lower after announcing a delay in releasing its Q4 and year-end 2016 financial results to Mar. 14 from Mar. 8.
    • CIE says it needs more time to complete operations on the North Platte #4 sidetrack well and provide a more comprehensive update.
    • CIE said last week it received a continued listing standard notice from the NYSE after shares averaged less than $1 for the preceding 30-day period.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 31 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: TGTX +90%. CNCE +81%. OTC:DXTR +62%. VBIV +13%. BIOS +12%.
    • Losers: MNKD -13%. TROV -9%. AKRX -8%. CALA -7%. ADAP -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • VALE

    Vale’s new CEO to be chosen in late March or early April, minister says

    • A decision on who will replace Vale (VALE -2.4%) CEO Murilo Ferreira, whose contract will not be renewed when it expires on May 26, could come by the end of March or beginning of April, Brazil Energy Minister Fernando Coelho Filho tells Reuters.
    • The minister says government pension funds will have a key role in the selection process, along with other partners in Vale.
    • Coelho also says bills to reform Brazil’s mining industry should go before the country's congress in late March or early April and could be enacted by 110 days after that.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • GM

    GM investors sell the Opel news

    • General Motors (NYSE:GM) is lower after announcing its monster deal to sell off Opel.
    • The company also disclosed today that it will lay off 1,100 workers in May at a Lansing plant as production shifts to Tennessee.
    • Nomura Instinet is one of the first investment firms to weigh in on the GM Opel decision. The firm lifts GM to a Buy rating on its view that the simplified business will be easier to manage and share buybacks will be ramped up.
    • Shares of GM are down 2.22% to $37.38
    • Previously: General Motors sells Opel for €2.2B (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 23 Comments
  • CETX

    Cemtrex -15% on report of factory closing

    • In an Instablog post on Seeking Alpha, Unemon1 takes note of German media stories from last week reporting Cemtrex (CETX -15.5%) is expected to close its Paderborn plant by the end of October.
    • Previously: Cemtrex -37%; threatens legal action over misleading article (Feb. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 5 Comments
  • CALM

    South Korea U.S. poultry ban to impact CALM and POST

    • A ban of poultry imports from the U.S. will impact Cal-Maine Foods (CALM -0.8%) most directly, warns Goldman Sachs.
    • Post Holdings (POST -1.8%) is expected to see a "modest" negative effect through its Michael's property, according to the firm.
    • South Korea banned U.S. poultry after the first confirmed case this year of the highly pathogenic H7 avian influenza was reported at a Tyson-contracted farm in Tennessee.
    • Previously: Tyson on alert after bird flu case in Tennessee (March 6)
    • Previously: Avian flu case sends SAFM and PPC lower (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 6 Comments
  • GURE

    Gulf Resources +2% on strong outlook for bromine business

    • Gulf Resources (GURE +2.1%) rises after announcing that continuing strength in the price of bromine should lead to significantly improved sales and earnings in bromine business, especially in H1 2017.
    • GURE says the price of bromine has continued to increase since the end of Q3 2016, and was +17% Y/Y to $4,142/metric ton at the beginning of March.
    • GURE will provide guidance when it releases financial results later this month, but says it has good visibility for H1 and expects increases in sales and earnings for bromine business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • DXTR

    Dextera's stapling platform reduces hospital stay in patients undergoing microlobectomy procedures; shares jump 38%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Dextera Surgical (OTC:DXTR +37.7%) heads north on a 6x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive data related to the use of its articulating surgical stapling platform in 82 patients undergoing microlobectomy (removal of a lobe of a lung via a small hole through the abdomen). The results were presented at the Scandinavian Society for Research in Cardiothoracic Surgery.
    • The data showed that the use of the company's MicroCutter 5/80 surgical stapler reduced postoperative pain and complications compared to traditional open procedures and reduced median hospital stay by at least two days. A fifth (20%) of the patients were able to be discharged the day after surgery.
    • The MicroCutter 5/80 Stapler is manufactured and cleared for use in the United States for transection and resection in multiple open or minimally invasive urologic, thoracic and pediatric surgical procedures, as well as other applications.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • FRP

    FairPoint -1.6% as Q4 profits miss amid revenue decline

    • FairPoint Communications (NASDAQ:FRP) has fallen 1.6% in early going after it posted mixed Q4 earnings where revenues declined slightly but beat expectations, and net income slid.
    • Net profit fell to $16M from $40.2M; EBITDA grew by $1M to $64.9M, beating an expected $62.2M.
    • Revenue breakout: Voice services, $71.5M (down 7.6%); Access, $58.2M (down 6.2%); Data and Internet services, $49.1M (up 9.3%); Regulatory funding, $12.5M (down 5%); Other services, $12.6M (up 2.4%).
    • It's guiding to 2017 unlevered free cash flow of $105M-$115M, capex of $110M-$115M and EBITDA of $245M-$250M (vs. consensus for $247.9M).
    • It won't hold a call due to its planned merger with Consolidated Communications (NASDAQ:CNSL); the two companies have special meetings set for March 28 to get shareholder approvals, with a targeted closing in mid-2017.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • VTR

    Brookdale Senior -5%; Ventas says not in talks

    • Presenting at the Citi Global Property Conference, Ventas (VTR -0.9%) says it's not currently in talks to purchase Brookdale Senior Living (BKD -4.9%).
    • Presentation slides
    • Previously: Ventas in talks to buy Brookdale Senior - DJ (Feb. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 12 Comments
  • IONS

    Ionis Pharma's volanesorsen successful in late-stage study in rare inherited enzyme disorder; effect on platelet counts weighs on shares, down 7%

    • Ionis Pharmaceuticals (IONS -6.9%) is down despite its announcement of successful results in a Phase 3 clinical trial, APPROACH, evaluating subsidiary Akcea Therapeutics' volanesorsen in lowering triglyceride levels in patients with familial chylomicronemia syndrome (FCS), a rare inherited enzyme disorder that results in excessive levels of triglycerides in the plasma.
    • The study met its primary endpoint but a treatment-related side effect is apparently concerning investors. Specifically, declines in platelet counts associated with decreases in triglycerides were observed in many patients. Five subjects discontinued treatment due to the side effect. The company adds that three patients experienced grade 4 (life-threatening) thrombocytopenia which resolved with cessation of dosing.
    • Volanesorsen is an antisense drug designed to reduce the production of ApoC-III, a protein produced by the liver that regulates triglyceride metabolism.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 28 Comments
  • FRGI

    Insider buying action propels Fiesta Restaurant Group

    • Fiesta Restaurant Group (FRGI +4.3%) board member Brain Paul Friedman picked upp 660K shares between March 1 and March 3.
    • The shares were picked up in a range of $19.83 to $20.68.
    • Fiesta SEC filings
    • Previously: Fiesta Restaurant Group looks to recover (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 4 Comments
  • SAFM

    Avian flu case sends SAFM and PPC lower

    • Shares of Sanderson Farms (SAFM -2.5%) and Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -1.8%) are lower after the first confirmed case of the highly pathogenic H7 avian influenza this year occurred at a Tyson-contracted farm in Tennessee.
    • Tyson is reportedly working with state and federal officials to contain the virus, while Pilgrim's Pride says it's activated a biosecurity response plan.
    • Previously: Tyson on alert after bird flu case in Tennessee (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • DAL

    Delta guidance rattles airline sector

    • Delta Air Lines (DAL -1.8%) rattles the airline sector with some fresh guidance issued at the Raymond James 38th Annual Institutional Investors Conference.
    • The company expects Q1 operating margin of 10% to 11% vs. a prior forecast of 11% to 13%.
    • Costs increases are expected to run ahead of revenue growth this year, according to Delta.
    • Passenger revenue per available seat mile is now seen as coming in flat for the quarter, down from a prior forecast for a range of flat to +2%.
    • Delta on margins: " Margins under pressure in 1H17, but we are focused on returning to margin expansion in the back half of the year as improving RASM trajectory catches up to cost increases."
    • Delta presentation slides (.pdf)
    • Other airline stocks moving in reaction to Delta's guidance include American Airlines Group (AAL -2.2%), United Continental (UAL -3%), Southwest Airlines (LUV -1.7%) and JetBlue (JBLU -2.1%).

  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular amends protocol of late-state study of lead product candidate to allow for faster randomization; shares ahead 17% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC) is up 17% premarket on modestly higher volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has approved its request to modify the protocol in its Phase 3 clinical trial assessing lead product candidate ICT-107 in newly diagnosed glioblastoma. The key change will allow patients to be randomized 30 days after the start of screening procedures, accelerating the time to randomization by ~two months. Currently, the estimated final data collection date for the primary endpoint of overall survival is December 2019.
    • ICT-107 is an autologous dendritic cell immunotherapeutic that targets six different antigens associated with glioblastoma. It is designed for use following surgical tumor resection of newly diagnosed glioblastoma in combination with radiotherapy and chemotherapy.
    • The company also announces the successful completion of the first milestone for its Stem-to-T-cell program, the sequencing of a selected T cell receptor (TCR) gene. When placed into a blood stem cell, the TCR gene should enhance the immune system to produce killer T cells to attack tumor cells.
    • Management will provide more details on both developments later this month during the Q4 conference call.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 9 Comments

    • Advaxis (NASDAQ:ADXS) perks up 10% premarket on average volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has approved its Investigational New Drug (IND) application for ADXS-NEO, a personalized neoantigen-targeted cancer immunotherapy that it is developing with Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN).

  • PTCT

    FDA to review PTC's marketing application for DMD candidate Translarna under protest regulations; action date October 24; shares ahead 15% premarket

    • PTC Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTCT) is up 15% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has acknowledged the filing of protest of its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of Translarna (ataluren) for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD). The agency's action date (PDUFA) is October 24.
    • The FDA rejected its original NDA filing in October 2016 under "Refuse to File"  which means that the application was not complete enough to allow for review. File over protest regulations allow a company to have its NDA filed and reviewed following receipt of a Refuse to File letter.
    • Related ticker: (NASDAQ:SRPT)
    • Previously: PTC Therapeutics hoping to follow Sarepta's path with FDA review of DMD candidate Translarna but gets rejected, appeal planned; shares down 21% premarket (Oct. 17, 2016)

    • Novan (NASDAQ:NOVN) perks up 12% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it will proceed with the development acne candidate SB204. Its decision was based on an internal assessment of the clinical trial data and input from consultants. Shares plummeted in January after one of two Phase 3 trials failed to meet all of its efficacy endpoints.
    • The company says it will seek a pre-submission meeting with the FDA in Q3 and expects to file a New Drug Application (NDA) in Q1 2018.
    • SB204 is a topical gel based on the company's NITRICIL technology which enables the timed release of nitric oxide, a molecule that regulates inflammation and boosts the immune system, among other effects.

  • TGTX

    TG Therapeutics's blood cancer candidate ublituximab successful in late-state study; shares jump 53% premarket

    • TG Therapeutics (NASDAQ:TGTX) is up 53% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 3 clinical trial,GENUINE, assessing TG-1101 (ublituximab) plus ibrutinib [AbbVie's (NYSE:ABBV) Imbruvica] in treatment-experienced high-risk chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) patients.
    • The study met its primary endpoint of overall response rate (ORR) compared to ibrutinib alone in both the intent-to-treat population (p=0.001) and treated population (p<0.001). Specifically, in the treated population, the ORR was 80% for TG-1101 plus ibrutinib versus 47% for ibrutinib alone.
    • A complete analysis of the data will be submitted for presentation at an upcoming medical conference. The company plans to meet with the FDA as soon as possible afterward to discuss an application for accelerated approval.
    • TG-1101 is a glycoengineered anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody.
